SEARCH
Package com.craftinginterpreters.lox

Class Environment

java.lang.Object
com.craftinginterpreters.lox.Environment
class Environment extends Object
The `Environment` class represents a symbol table for storing variables and their values. It is used to track variable bindings in a Lox program, including nested environments.

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    (package private) final Environment
    enclosing
    The enclosing environment.
    private final Map<String,Object>
    values
    A map that associates variable names (as strings) with their corresponding values.

    Creates a new environment with the specified enclosing environment.

  • Field Details

    • enclosing

      final Environment enclosing
      The enclosing environment. This is used for handling variable scoping.

    • values

      private final Map<String,Object> values
      A map that associates variable names (as strings) with their corresponding values.

  • Constructor Details

    • Environment

      Environment()
      Creates a new top-level environment with no enclosing environment.

    • Environment

      Environment(Environment enclosing)
      Creates a new environment with the specified enclosing environment.
      Parameters:
      enclosing - The enclosing environment.

  • Method Details

    • get

      Object get(Token name)
      Retrieves the value associated with a variable by its token name.
      Parameters:
      name - The token representing the variable name.
      Returns:
      The value of the variable.
      Throws:
      RuntimeError - If the variable is undefined in this and all enclosing environments.

    • assign

      void assign(Token name, Object value)
      Assigns a new value to an existing variable by its token name. If the variable doesn't exist in this environment, it checks enclosing environments.
      Parameters:
      name - The token representing the variable name.
      value - The new value to assign.
      Throws:
      RuntimeError - If the variable is undefined in this and all enclosing environments.

    • define

      void define(String name, Object value)
      Defines a new variable in the current environment with the specified name and value.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the variable.
      value - The initial value of the variable.

    • ancestor

      Environment ancestor(int distance)
      Retrieves the ancestor environment at a specified distance from the current environment.
      Parameters:
      distance - The number of ancestor environments to traverse.
      Returns:
      The ancestor environment.

    • getAt

      Object getAt(int distance, String name)
      Retrieves the value of a variable at a specified distance and name.
      Parameters:
      distance - The distance to the ancestor environment where the variable is defined.
      name - The name of the variable.
      Returns:
      The value of the variable.

    • assignAt

      void assignAt(int distance, Token name, Object value)
      Assigns a new value to a variable at a specified distance and name.
      Parameters:
      distance - The distance to the ancestor environment where the variable is defined.
      name - The token representing the variable name.
      value - The new value to assign.
